p: Tartary buckwheat sprouts have been used as ingredient for a new “functional” pasta, which has been proven to reduce cardiovascular risk and metabolic disorders, such as hypertension in rats [ 243]. Authors have shown that spontaneously hypertensive rats fed with pasta containing tartary buckwheat sprouts (30% vs. 70% durum wheat semolina) exhibited improved levels of blood pressure-related biochemical parameters, probably attributable to the higher levels of rutin and its aglycone quercetin.
